labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

issues.title: Timestamp and validity should also be added to "Location"  from  Adrian during WG adoption
issues.author: lana-wu
issues.body:
I’m interested to see that the timestamp and validity are present under the geolocation part of the tree (good), except…
**Why don’t they apply to more of the parts of the tree?** 

Actually, I wasn’t thinking about mobility (although there are fields in which inventory is mobile – military, emergency services, ad hoc, satellite).
I was thinking about validity:
-	This data was set up in 1856, the name of the country may have changed since then.
-	This data depends on a satellite GPS system that may have become detuned since then.
-	This data was set up when the company was independent before I was acquired by MegaCorp.

A

[https://mailarchive.ietf.org/arch/msg/inventory-yang/IRs24T4q0eCjGo5fK8v1OPepF0E/](url)

issues.title: Suggestion to add usage of the YANG model and the nodes from Med
issues.author: lana-wu
issues.body:
During WG adoption, Med made the suggestion:

I’d expect the document to first explain the intended usage of the existing data nodes. 
For example, 
- how this will impact items in which a given location is referenced? 
- How one can retrieve the list of items that are associated with a given location? 
- How to proceed when the location is not valid? Etc.

Cheers,
Med

issues.title: Place the model under “network-inventory” top-level container defined in base inventory model?
issues.author: lana-wu
issues.body:
During WG adoption, Italo made the comments:

I have just a small comment (which can be addressed by the WG after adoption) about the location of the top-level container “locations”. IMHO, it could be placed under the “network-inventory” top-level container defined in the base inventory model:

OLD

module: ietf-ni-location
  +--rw locations

NEW

module: ietf-ni-location
  augment /nwi:network-inventory:
    +--rw locations

Italo (as contributor)

issues.title: Med's review comments on the description and IETF format
issues.author: lana-wu
issues.body:
Med's review comments on the description and IETF format during WG adoption

I already reviewed a previous version of this document. Here are some quick additional comments:


  *   NIT

OLD:

The location model can  extend the base network inventory

   [I-D.ietf-ivy-network-inventory-yang] to enrich NEs with location

   information.

NEW:

The location model augments

   the base network inventory

   [I-D.ietf-ivy-network-inventory-yang] to enrich NEs with location

   information.


  *   NIT

OLD:

   The Network Inventory location model is classified as a network

   configuration model (Section 4 of [RFC8309]).

NEW:

   The Network Inventory location model is classified as a network

   model (Section 3.5.1 of [I-D.ietf-netmod-rfc8407bis]).


  *   Question:

CURRENT:

   The Network Inventory location YANG model conforms to the Network

   Management Datastore Architecture (NMDA) [RFC8342].

Per the IETF guidelines, new models should comply with 8342. What is actually important to highlight is the following:

"Designers SHOULD describe and justify any NMDA exceptions in detail, such as the use of separate subtrees and/or separate leafs."

I guess this can be revisited once the module is stable.


  *   Clarification (many occurrences): not sure how these two are related? Whether they are redundant? Etc.

CURRENT:


        |  +--rw name?               string

        |  +--rw alias?              string


  *   Security section: Please follow the updated template at https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-ietf-netmod-rfc8407bis-16#name-security-considerations-sect.


  *   IANA section: Please update the following to refer to 6020:


OLD:
   This document registers a YANG module in the "YANG Module Names"
   registry[RFC7950] .

NEW:

   This document registers a YANG module in the "YANG Module Names"

   Registry [RFC6020] .
Cheers,
Med
